Jianghua Island is the fifth largest island in South Korea, with a bridge connected to the land. There are many historical sites here, and some are prehistoric. There are many specialties on the island, but the traffic is really not very convenient, the air is very good, it is suitable for an outdoor trip.

Very accessible by car from Seoul! It's really nice to drive around the island, as it has a nice village feel. I especially recommend stopping by the Seongmodo Mineral Hot spring, which is an outdoor hot spring. It was really refreshing and it's nice to be outdoor. The beach on the island isn't really memorable though as the water was really muddy.

There are a lot of seafood to eat on the island, seafood porridge, seafood noodles, shells, it is used to bake, not bad. The price is also cheaper than Seoul. I asked my classmates. I said this grilled seafood thing. Is there in Seoul? The classmates said that there are some, but there is no fresh here.

Jianghua Island is the fifth largest island in South Korea, located on the West coast. Jianghua Island has many famous specialties. Jianghua ginseng with outstanding curative effect, Jianghua turnip with unique taste, and mottled stone. Patterned stone is a traditional Korean specialty. It is famous for its exquisite craft and function.
It’s also a bit of a historical place to look at.

Jianghua Island has been inhabited by many people since prehistoric times. It has many historical relics and cultural relics. One of the most representative is the pillar tomb designated as the world cultural heritage. The Stone Tomb is a tomb built entirely with stones by the residents of Jianghua Island in the Bronze Age of Korea when burying the ruling class. The Star Plaza of the Mani Graben on Jianghua Island goes up many steps to reach its peak, where the West China Sea and land can be seen. This is where the Sandalwood King thriftily offered sacrifices to heaven. Jianghua Island has many famous specialties. Jianghua ginseng with obvious curative effect, Jianghua turnip with unique taste, and mottled stone. Patterned stone is a traditional specialty of Korea, which is famous for its exquisite craftsmanship and functions.
There are many temples, parks and beautiful scenery.

Jianghua County is located at the west end of the central part of the Korean Peninsula. Its east side is connected with Jinpu City through Jianghua Bridge and Caozhi Bridge. Its north side is across the sea from Korea, and its west side is the sea, which connects with the Yellow Sea of China. Jianghua Island has four distinct seasons. Although it is an island, its marine climate is not obvious. The annual average temperature is 11.2 degrees and the annual average precipitation is 1330 mm. To blow the northwest series of wind, the average annual wind speed is about 1.5/S. Jianghua Island, the seat of the prefecture, is the fifth largest island in South Korea. It covers an area of 410 square kilometers and consists of 29 islands, including 11 islands for some people and 18 islands for no one. Jianghua County is located at the west end of the central part of the Korean Peninsula. Its east side is connected with Jinpu City through Jianghua Bridge and Caozhi Bridge. Its north side is across the sea from Korea, and its west side is the sea, which connects with the Yellow Sea of China. Jianghua Island has four distinct seasons. Although it is an island, its marine climate is not obvious. The annual average temperature is 11.2 degrees and the annual average precipitation is 1330 mm. It mainly blows northwest series wind with an average annual wind speed of about 1.5/S.

Jianghua Island is the fifth largest island in South Korea, located on the West coast. It consists of 11 inhabited islands and 17 uninhabited islands with a coastline of about 99 kilometers. Jianghua Island has been inhabited by many people since prehistoric times. It has many historical relics and cultural relics.
Jianghua Island has good scenery, good air and few people. There are basically no tour groups coming here. There are lawns and seas. The sea breeze is very comfortable and suitable for honeymoon.

Jianghua Island is the fifth largest island in South Korea. There are many historical sites, cultural relics and specialties on the island. Agricultural products are very popular, but the traffic is not very convenient, the air is very good, the natural scenery is beautiful, and it is very suitable for a good place for outdoor travel.

When you come to Jianghua Island, you must not miss the sashimi dinner. The fresh ingredients are fairly priced. Four people are only 100,000 yuan, which is much cheaper than in Seoul. And after dinner, you can buy a bundle of shrimp sticks to feed seagulls next to you, and you can get in touch with them more intimately than any zoo. There is also a unique handicraft art in Jianghua Island, that is Jianghua pattern mat. It is more meaningful to experience the decorative mat made by hand than to buy it at the expense of money. Teachers will teach kindly, and also play Chinese teaching videos.
Jianghua Island, where there are many seagulls, very beautiful, visitors here are also very many, very suitable for children and the elderly to come here for vacation, like friends must not miss oh

Jianghua Island, located at the mouth of the North Han River, is the gateway to South Korea. It has become a place for military strategists since ancient times. There are many historic sites on the island and the most famous Chuandeng Temple.

Ganghwado, also known by its native name Ganghwa Island is a South Korean island in the estuary of the Han River.It is in the Yellow Sea, off Korea's west coast.The island is separated from Gimpo by a narrow channel spanned by two bridges, and from Kaesong in North Korea by the main channel of the Han River.
